    • findAppearsInById

      @Query(value=" select e.label from human_appears_in dai, episode e where dai.episode_id=e.id and dai.human_id = ?1", nativeQuery=true) java.util.List<java.lang.String> findAppearsInById​(java.util.UUID id)

    • findByAppearsIn

      @Query(value=" select d.id, d.name, d.home_planet from human d, human_appears_in dai, episode e where e.label = ?1 and dai.episode_id=e.id and dai.human_id=d.id", nativeQuery=true) java.util.List<Human> findByAppearsIn​(java.lang.String episode)

    • findFriends

      @Query(value=" select d.id, d.name, d.home_planet from human d, character_friends f where f.character_id = ?1 and f.friend_id = d.id ", nativeQuery=true) java.util.List<Human> findFriends​(java.util.UUID id)

    • addFriend

      @Modifying @Query(value="insert into character_friends (character_id, friend_id) values (?1, ?2)", nativeQuery=true) void addFriend​(java.util.UUID idCharacter, java.util.UUID idFriend)

    • findById

      @Query(value="select id, name, home_planet from human where id = ?1", nativeQuery=true) java.util.Optional<Human> findById​(java.util.UUID id)
      As in this implementation, we have separate tables for the concrete classes of the Character interface, we use a nativeQuery. Another option is to use a CharacterImpl view.
      Specified by:
      findById in interface org.springframework.data.repository.CrudRepository<Human,​java.util.UUID>
